description: Ms. codex. Title from illuminated title page (fol. 1bis(a)). Physical description: 13 lines per page. Written in medium small naskh in black ink with use of red for headings and entries. The text is vocalized. Dark cream paper, hardly translucid, with pulp, chain and laid lines visible. Collation notes on the margin. Table of contents on fol. 1b. Erased inscription on fol. 75b. Fol.i-iv are modern fly-leaves, contemporary with the modern binding. On the verso of the last modern upper cover fly-leaf is a pasted piece of paper with inscription in Arabic reading: "Sanah 595" (fol. iv(b)). Modern foliation in pencil using Western numerals (omits the first folio; blank between fol. 17 and 18). Decoration: Illuminated title page executed in gold and blue on fol. 1bis(a). Rectangular panel (400 x 850 mm.) bearing the title over a medallion (820 mm.) bearing the name of the patron of the copy. Chiefly quinions. Origin: According to illuminated title page, copied for the library of "Mawlānā al-Sulṭān al-Malik al-Nāṣir Ṣalāḥ al-Dunyā wa-al-Dīn Abū al-Muẓaffar Yūsuf ibn al-Malik al-ʻAzīz" (fol. 1bis(a)). Incipit: بسم ... رب اعن ان القدما من اهل اليونانية تسلموا اكثر علومهم النجومية من الهند Explicit: على كثرة المال بالكسب وهى رديه للبدايات تمت الدرج بحمد الله ما اُغفِل ايْراد خَواصه من الكواكب فى دَرْجَةٍ دَرْجَةٍ فانا عوّلنا فيه على مزاجه وطبعه ... [65ب] ... وهذّبنا العبارة عنه من غري تغير لشى منه والله الموفق للصواب (واليه المرجع والمآب) تم الكتاب والحمد لله وحده ولى الله على خير خلقه (محمد وآله و) سلامه ه
author: Ibn Shākir, Aḥmad ibn Mūsá, d. 873
abstract: Treatise on astrology. The text proper ends on fol. 64a. It is followed by a short section written by the same hand, entitled: "Mā ughfila īrād khawāṣṣihi min al-kawākib". The second text mentioned in the table of contents added by a later hand on fol. 1a, with the title "Kitāb al-Mukhtaṣar fī maʻrifat al-taqāwīm fī ʻilm al-falak li-baʻḍ al-fuḍalā", does not appear in the copy, unless this refers to the short addition at the end of the text.
alternative: Kitāb Aḥkām al-daraj li-l-mawālīd ithná ʻashar burjan li-Banī Mūsá
كتاب احكام الدرج للمواليد اثنى عشر برجا لبني موسى
extent: iv, 68, iv leaves : paper ; 170 x 120 (115 x 80) mm. bound to 175 x 130 mm.
provenance: On fol.1a: Ownership statement in the name of al-Sayyid ʻAbd al-Ḥayy ibn al-Sayyid ʻAlī al-Ḥusaynī(?) al-Qudsī al-Shāfiʻī al-Shāmī (dated beginning of 1043 H. [1633]) ; three reading statements in the name of Aḥmad ibn ʻAbd al-Ḥayy al-Ḥusaynī(?) al-Qudsī, of ʻAlī ibn Aḥmad ibn Ibrāhīm al-Tadmurī (dated 1120 H. [1708 or 9]), of Ḥasan al-Tadmurī. Acquired by Robert Garrett from Brill, Leyden, 1900.

subject: Astrology, Arab—9th century
binding_note: Modern quarter binding in marbled paper and red leather. An earlier binding consisting of blind tooled red leather over paper pasteboards is kept with the ms.
